project.name: tic-tac-toe
project.notes: Run this project in turbo mode.

scripts.comment: PLEASE RUN THIS PROJECT IN TURBO MODE.

custom-block.s: winning triple for player %s on board %l
winning square for player %s on board %l
Computer can win on this move %s %l
Human can win on this move %s %l
winning square for player %s on board %l

block.comment: this will be reported only if the game is going to draw.

block.l: Would you like to go first (X) or second (O)? Please enter 1 or 2.
It's your turn! Click in an open square.
You can't move there please try again.

custom-block.comment: You are responsible for this block.

block.l: Great job you beat the computer!

block.comment: go through the board list and get each value using the triple index number.
use triple_indexes to get board's values.
the replace block above will replace the current_winning_triples value with each triple value.
go through a triple to get their values.

block-definition.s: winning triple for player %'player' on board %'board'
block-definition.comment: this is where all of the important stuff happens.

block.comment: we set winning_triple if we found 2 of our players in a triple.
else, set the best_empty_triple with that has 1 of our player.
finally, if none of the above case is true. set the best_empty_positions that doesn't contain opponent player. Useful when the game has just started.

block-definition.s: winning square for player %'player' on board %'board'

custom-block.s: winning triple for player %s on board %l

block.comment: if the winning spot is available take it.
if no winning spot available, pick a spot in a triple that has one of our player.

custom-block.comment: else, just choose best empty number that has the most appearance in a winning_triples.

block-definition.s: Computer can win on this move %'player' %'board'

custom-block.s: winning square for player %s on board %l

block-definition.s: Human can win on this move %'player' %'board'

custom-block.s: winning square for player %s on board %l
